channel.title: Microsoft-Foundry on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Microsoft-Foundry on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: ai: What’s new in Microsoft Foundry | Dec 2025 & Jan 2026
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry’s Dec 2025–Jan 2026 updates add several new foundation models, expand audio and fine-tuning capabilities, and introduce SDK changes including an azure-ai-projects v2 beta consolidation.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: DPO Fine-Tuning Using Microsoft Foundry SDK
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry published a guide on using the Foundry SDK to fine-tune LLMs with Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) to better align outputs with human preferences.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Claude Opus 4.6, Available on Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry now offers Claude Opus 4.6 in public preview, making Anthropic’s Opus 4.6 model available on Azure for enterprise use.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: ai: What’s new in Microsoft Foundry | October and November 2025
item.description:
Azure AI Foundry has been renamed Microsoft Foundry. The October–November 2025 update highlights new announcements across agents, models, tools, and related platform improvements.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Mistral Large 3 in Foundry
item.description:
Mistral Large 3, a frontier-class open-weight model licensed under Apache 2.0, is now available in Microsoft Foundry on Azure in Public Preview, offering enterprise-grade reliability, long-context comprehension, and multimodal reasoning suitable for production use.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: ai: Announcing Foundry MCP Server (preview), speeding up AI development with Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Foundry MCP Server (preview), building on the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to help AI agents securely connect with apps, data, and systems. At Ignite, Microsoft Foundry also introduced Foundry Tools as a central hub to discover, connect, and manage both public and private MCP tools securely, simplifying integration and expanding interoperability.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Introducing Multi-Agent Workflows in Foundry Agent Service
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry introduces Multi-Agent Workflows in the Foundry Agent Service to help organizations move beyond single-purpose agents toward orchestrated, multi-step, role-based AI processes that include stronger governance and operational dependability for enterprise use.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Translation Customization, A Developer’s Guide to Adaptive Custom Translation
item.description:
This Microsoft Foundry Blog post, “Translation Customization, A Developer’s Guide to Adaptive Custom Translation,” argues that translation is more than word-for-word conversion and is essential for global business communication. It highlights the need for accuracy, speed, and domain-specific terminology — noting that 70% of consumers prefer content in their native language — and frames a developer-focused guide for implementing adaptive custom translation to enable real-time, high-quality multilingual experiences.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Claude Opus 4.5 Available in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Claude Opus 4.5 is available in public preview on Microsoft Foundry for Azure customers, introducing improvements in coding, agentic workflows, and enterprise productivity with upgraded performance and versatility.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: ai: How to debug and optimize RAG agents in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
This tutorial shows how to evaluate and optimize retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) agents in Microsoft Foundry using Foundry Observability. It recommends running end-to-end, reference-free RAG triad evaluators (Groundedness and Relevance) and applying advanced search and retrieval tuning before deployment.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Introducing GPT-4o Audio Models in Microsoft Foundry: A Practical Guide for Developers
item.description:
A practical developer guide from Microsoft Foundry showing how to start using Azure OpenAI’s next-generation GPT-4o audio models to build transcription and text-to-speech applications. The post explains the capabilities of the audio models, required setup in Azure/OpenAI and Foundry, best practices for integration, and considerations for testing, deployment, and costs.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Announcing Azure Language in Foundry Tools for deterministic, privacy-first agents
item.description:
Microsoft announced the integration of Azure Language into Foundry Tools to support building enterprise-grade agents that emphasize deterministic behavior and stronger privacy protections. The update is positioned to help teams create predictable, secure agentic applications with tighter integration across their AI stack.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: ai: Assess Agentic Risks with the AI Red Teaming Agent in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry now offers major public-preview enhancements for models and agentic AI pipelines, including an AI Red Teaming Agent that helps organizations proactively identify and mitigate safety and security risks in models and agentic systems before they enter production.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Managed Redis integration with Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Azure Managed Redis is now available in the Microsoft Foundry MCP tools catalog as a Public Preview, enabling customers to use Redis as a knowledge or memory store for Foundry-based AI agents and simplifying the connection between Redis and those agents.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Microsoft Foundry data connection for Azure Databricks
item.description:
Azure Databricks Genie is now integrated with Microsoft Foundry and available in public preview, enabling Genie spaces to connect directly to Foundry agents via the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to give seamless access to trusted data for building intelligent solutions.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Claude in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft announced that Anthropic’s Claude models are generally available in Microsoft Foundry, giving enterprises access to Claude Sonnet 4.5, Opus 4.1, and Haiku 4.5 for advanced long-context reasoning, coding, and multimodal capabilities within Foundry’s unified frontier AI ecosystem.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Cosmos DB MCP ToolKit for Microsoft Foundry Agent Service
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL now provides an MCP Toolkit for use with the Microsoft Foundry Agent Service, available in public preview; the integration enables Microsoft Foundry Agents to connect directly to data stored in Azure Cosmos DB.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Native Microsoft Foundry support for Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description:
Microsoft announced the public preview of native Microsoft Foundry support for Azure Database for PostgreSQL. The Azure PostgreSQL MCP Server is now integrated with Microsoft Foundry, enabling the creation of AI agents that can securely query and analyze PostgreSQL data.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Announcing: Developer Training tier for low-cost fine-tuning training
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry announced a Developer Training tier (preview) that offers ultra-low-cost fine-tuning model training by using spot capacity. The tier aims to provide training affordability comparable to the existing Developer hosting tier, specifically for the training phase of fine-tuning workflows.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Agent mitigations and guardrail customization
item.description:
Microsoft is previewing agent-level guardrails in the Foundry Control Plane (formerly content filters) that let you apply and customize safety controls per agent to help mitigate prompt-injection and other risks.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Enrich agents with a unified catalog of prebuilt and custom tools in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry (public preview) introduces a unified catalog of Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools that let developers enrich agents with real-time business context, multimodal capabilities, and custom business logic.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Enterprise MCP enhancements in Foundry Agent Service
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry (Foundry Agent Service) now supports enhanced Enterprise MCP integration in public preview, enabling secure, authenticated connections that let credentials be passed to MCP servers securely to improve flexibility, security, and compliance.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Microsoft Foundry Control Plane & Entra Agent ID
item.description:
Microsoft has announced a public preview of Microsoft Foundry Control Plane and Entra Agent ID, a unified platform for enterprise AI agent observability, security, and governance. The Control Plane combines identity, monitoring, and compliance capabilities to provide centralized control, deep observability, and regulatory alignment for AI agents.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Microsoft Foundry Fine-Tuning Updates
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry Fine-Tuning enters Public Preview with a complete UI redesign that emphasizes an agent-first experience. The updated interface streamlines model creation, evaluation, and deployment workflows and adds integration with Visual Studio to improve developer and data scientist productivity.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Microsoft Foundry one-click deploy channels in Teams, M365 and non-Microsoft
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry is in public preview with a one-click, no-code publishing feature that lets organizations deploy custom agents to Microsoft Teams, Microsoft 365 Copilot, and non-Microsoft channels, removing pro-code deployment complexity and enabling instant reach to large user bases.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: New AI templates in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry is in Public Preview with new ready-to-use, customizable AI templates for common scenarios—such as live voice agents, release management, data unification, and SharePoint integrations—that eliminate repetitive setup tasks and speed development.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: New granular controls for network and integration security in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry is releasing a Public Preview with more granular controls for network and integration security and resource management, enabling IT administrators to deploy enterprise AI solutions while meeting governance and security requirements.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Content Understanding in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of Content Understanding, which now connects to Microsoft Foundry model deployments and adds enterprise features including VNet, Managed Identity, and Customer Managed Key support.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Foundry Tools (rebrand from Azure AI Services)
item.description:
Microsoft announced Foundry Tools (rebranded from Azure AI Services) as generally available — a unified suite of prebuilt, production-ready AI capabilities for audio, video, images, documents, and text, seamlessly integrated into the Microsoft Foundry platform to empower developers.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Model Router in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry’s Model Router is now generally available. The Model Router is an AI orchestration layer that dynamically selects the optimal model for each prompt and now supports a broader range of models including the GPT-4 family, GPT-5 family, GPT-oss, and Deepse.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Streamline IT governance, security, and cost management experiences with Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry’s enterprise features are now generally available, providing IT administrators tools to streamline AI development and management while enforcing enterprise-grade security, compliance, governance, and cost controls.

  • Source: Azure Updates
